techniques.name: Exploit Public-Facing Application
techniques.description: Adversaries may attempt to take advantage of a weakness in an Internet-facing computer or program using software, data, or commands in order to cause unintended or unanticipated behavior.

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: JavaScript
techniques.description: Adversaries may abuse JavaScript to execute various behaviors.

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter
techniques.description: Adversaries may abuse command and script interpreters to execute commands, scripts, or binaries.

techniques.name: Server Software Component: Web Shell
techniques.description: Adversaries may backdoor web servers with web shells to establish persistent access to systems.

techniques.name: Exfiltration Over C2 Channel
techniques.description: Adversaries may steal data by exfiltrating it over an existing command and control channel.

techniques.name: Data from Local System
techniques.description: Adversaries may search for and collect sensitive data from local system sources.

techniques.name: Brute Force
techniques.description: Adversaries may use brute force techniques to gain access to accounts.

techniques.name: File and Directory Discovery
techniques.description: Adversaries may enumerate files and directories or may search in specific locations of a host or network share for certain information within a file system.
